name: Chef John's Refried Beans
author: Chef John
summary: I don't think I would ever sit down to eat just a bowl of refried beans, but they make everything they're served on, with, or in, infinitely better. Just as long as you use lard to make them.
ingredients: 1 pound dry pinto beans, soaked overnight
directions: Drain soaked beans and transfer them to a stock pot
Add garlic, epazote, and cold water
Place pot over high heat and bring to a boil
Simmer uncovered until beans are soft, 1 1/2 to 2 hours
Drain the beans and reserve all the liquid
Melt lard in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Add onions and salt; cook until onions start to brown, 10 to 12 minutes
Stir in serrano pepper and chipotle powder; cook 1 minute
Mash about half the beans with a potato masher or back of a spoon
Ladle some bean cooking liquid to skillet
Continue to mash and stir beans as you gradually add more liquid
Mash until the beans have reached your preferred consistency and texture
Taste and add more salt, if desired
